Hi! My name is Davis Land.

I'm a student at Texas A&M University, studying Telecommunications and Media Studies.

I like to make stuff.

I was formerly an intern at Atlantic Public Media in Woods Hole, MA. I've also worked on a bunch of other projects with different levels and sizes of organizations. Currently I serve as the Editor-In-Chief for two publications: The Eckleburg Project, which is A&M's student-run literary journal, and Alien Mouth, an independent journal and press I started with a friend.

I work for the Texas A&M University Writing Center where I produce a podcast called (http://writerightpodcast.github.io)Write Right]. I've also served as the Programming Director for KANM Student Radio for a good while now, while djing and volunteering at KEOS Community Radio. I also produce a podcast for Write About Now Poetry, which is in its third season of production.

I've gained a lot of different skills through making stuff; here's an incomplete list: audio and video editing, web design and computer programming, how to do writing good, emailing (it's a skill, trust me), being funny sometimes, Twitter (that's also a skill I think), book binding, the entire Adobe Creative Cloud suite, cooking, having a critical eye, driving in Boston, paying off a credit card, being a leader, the Do Not Disturb feature on my phone, tying shoes, high fiving, being a direct communicator, and a few more things.

Here is a link to my resume. Here is my profile on AIR. Here is my profile on LinkedIn.
